text:
we have a JIRA issue here: <https://gerrit.hyperledger.org/r/#/c/2355/1> in this commit
shouldn't we have an explanation there?
Hi Gabor, yes, I saw that too.
There was that discussion in the underlying (<https://jira.hyperledger.org/browse/FAB-788>)
… but I agree that we need to talk more about “why” (that is, more at the requirements stage).
100% agree
<@U0KPFAZNF>  - are we now moving go Go 1.7 for fabric master?
We introduced 1.7 with baseimage v0.2.0 a few weeks back
is CI updated to use 1.7 as well?
I don't believe so, no. It's in the works. Also, the patches I am working on for docker obviates the need outright
(Since the build would occur within docker with baseimage providing the compiler)
It is my hope that in the near future, "devenv" and "cienv" are reduced to simple docker platforms
I would like to ask somebody ( <@U0PB67X4K>  ) to review these: <https://gerrit.hyperledger.org/r/#/c/2037> <https://gerrit.hyperledger.org/r/#/c/2065>
<@U1AU8DRQR>  - done.  I had looked at it before and code was good.  Since Jason +2 as well I'm good
<@U0PB67X4K> Any reason you were shy on the submit button?
forgot to
my multi-tasking failed me
apparently I max out at doing 5 things at a time  :wink:
God bless you, it is in now
folks - gotta step out for about an hour just in case someone is looking for me
<https://gerrit.hyperledger.org/r/#/c/2355/>   - replacing rocksdb with goleveldb
<https://gerrit.hyperledger.org/r/#/c/2363/> - step towards refactoring to BCCSP interface
any takers on this one:   <https://gerrit.hyperledger.org/r/#/c/2339/>
